name: 2nd Try
desc: 2nd Try is a googly-eyed horizontal spinner with a massive weapon - watch out!

name: 80 Pc Rotary Fool Kit
desc: A $6.99 knockoff Dremel from harbor freight shoved in an ant with a drill bit.

name: Aardvark
desc: Aardvark utilizes front-facing forks to control it's opponent.

name: Ampere
desc: Vertical Drisk

name: AntMINE
desc: AntMINE is the immovable object to your unstoppable force. It's sole purpose is cancelling kinetic weapons. Pray you can go the distance in the durability game.

name: BlackBaron
desc: BlackBaron is a TPU pusher bot
column5: sporting some frontward facing forks.

name: Blastwave
desc: Drum Spinner with four wheels.

name: Blight
desc: Blight is a 4WD vert. It features large titanium plows which provide ample front-end defense.

name: BONK
desc: this is BONK's first competition BONK's servo comes from an old robot dog and has over 10 replacements! so hit it hard! BONK 's Frame is printed using a PETG filament that has more durable properties than regular PETG BONK likes being scratched under the wheels

name: Bowser's Fury
desc: Bowser's Fury takes on a new meaning of terror as it spins and launches the competition across the arena!

name: Cavorting Beastie
desc: A durable wedge bot that dances around the arena!

name: Chaotic Destructor
desc: Big brother of Chaotic Rampage
column5: Chaotic Destructor is coming into battle with some fierce hitting power. Sporting a 6 inch AR500 steel weapon
column6: it's ready to deal massive damage!.

name: Chaotic Rampage
desc: Chaotic Rampage is a verticle bar spinner that is set up to do big
column5: one hit damage. It's 6 bar deals out serious damage while still being nimble. You never know what's going to happen after each hit so watch out!

name: Chicken Dinner
desc: Utilizes a vertical spinner and a wedge. It looks to be based on the FingerTech Viper design.

name: Circuit Breaker
desc: This bot is TBD

desc: Vertical Spinner and has Previously won first at an RSL event

name: CookieCutter
desc: Cookie Cutter utilizes a vertical spinner and wedge. It is a returning RSL champion
column5: having taken 1st at the first RSL Legion tournament.

name: Exogenesis
desc: Exogenesis is using a flipper - very cool!

name: Fairy Powerful
desc: A 4-wheel drive drisk with a Sylveon-inspired paint scheme. This is the bot I've wanted to build since I decided to build robots.

name: Faraday
desc: Shuffler Undercutter

name: FP Mini
desc: 4WD dual-disk vertical spinner.  Antweight (U.S.) version of my Sylveon-inspired bot concept Fairy Powerful.

name: GraFight
desc: GraFight is a returning champ
column5: and one of the very few bots to have made it to every single RSL event in Minnesota. GraFight is an RSL favorite - nicknamed The Roomba of Doom.

name: Greenhorn
desc: Greenhorn is a new design; it sports an overhead saw for top armor inspections

desc: Mess With The Best  Die Like The Rest

desc: Jimmy Jazz is a beta edition of the new Scalar 1 lbs combat robot kit. Current record: 5 wins
column5: 2 losses.

name: Johhny Crash
desc: Johhny Crash is a circular bot with a metal shell. It has fought in previous tournaments under the alias Supernova.

name: Lawnmower of Chaos
desc: Lawnmower of Chaos (L.M.O.C.) is an overhead
column5: full-body bar spinner. Also

name: Mars
desc: All of Night Sky Robotics bots have celestial themes to them Mars features a vertical drum spinner with hardened steel blades
column5: aluminum chassis covered Ultra High Molecular Weight Polyethylene This bot is driven by 9 year old Rory
column6: while his sister Molly helps in the pits and dad Matt builds and maintains the bot

name: Melon Brawler
desc: 4wd liftyboi

name: Metis
desc: Metis
column5: the goddess of wisdom
column6: teaches us the ways of combat and changes as the need arises. What does she bring to the challenge this time and are you ready?

name: Neon
desc: Neon is a TPU pusher bot
column5: with a large front wedge.

name: Noctilucent
desc: Noctilucent is a drisc
column5: vertical spinner. It appears to utilize large ablative foam wheels.

name: Painkiller
desc: Faster than a bullet. Terrifying scream. Enraged and full of anger. He is the Painkiller. This is the Painkiller.

name: Pork Lift
desc: Pork Lift is a pig-themed lifter
column5: capable of using either a forked or wedge configuration. Both include googly eyes. Oink!

name: Project Mayhem
desc: Project Mayhem is a bristle bot
column5: it moves by vibrating on toothbrush heads. It has a “turtle mode” where it sits on it's belly to get more traction and a faster spin up. It started as a joke robot and has never successfully reached full speed
column6: but has as much damage potential as the average robot at only 25% throttle. The weapon system weighs as much as its opponents.

name: RedDragon
desc: RedDragon is a TPU pusher bot
column5: sporting a really cool sticker.

name: Rip and Tear
desc: Rip & Tear
column5: formerly Tornado of Destruction & Dad's Spinner
column6: is a returning RSL finalist. It is a horizontal spinner that can cause some serious damage! Just like Doom Guy
column7: this bot rips and tears its way through the competition.

name: Robot A
desc: A rectangular test platform with delusions of grandeur.

name: Sash
desc: Sash is a fully upgraded kit bot! Seen here using a 2-wheel drive system and horizontal spinner.

name: Skippy
desc: Skippy is a returning RSL finalist. It utilizes a FingerTech beater bar.

name: SLAM
desc: SLAM or Slightly Larger Awesome Machine is a returning RSL champ
column5: having won the Minnesota Mecha Melee. It is a uniquely designed vertical spinner with wedges on each side.

name: Specture
desc: Both RSL and MRCA has seen the beetleweight version of Specture perform quite well - having taken second place at the Minnesota Monster Mash and first place at the MRCA Finals in 2023.

name: spin to win
desc: as long as the blade keeps going
column5: I'm winning
